content.content:
CREATE TABLE postLinks
(
    Id            INTEGER      not null
        primary key,
    CreationDate  DATETIME null,
    PostId        INTEGER      null,
    RelatedPostId INTEGER      null,
    LinkTypeId    INTEGER      null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (RelatedPostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE postLinks
(
    Id            INTEGER      not null
        primary key,
    CreationDate  DATETIME null,
    PostId        INTEGER      null,
    RelatedPostId INTEGER      null,
    LinkTypeId    INTEGER      null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (RelatedPostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Now let me query to find the post and its related post link.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT p1.Id, p1.Title, pl.LinkTypeId, pl.RelatedPostId, p2.Title AS RelatedTitle FROM posts p1 JOIN postLinks pl ON p1.Id = pl.PostId JOIN posts p2 ON pl.RelatedPostId = p2.Id WHERE p1.Title = 'What are principal component scores?';"
input.description: Find post links for the given post title

content.content:
222|What are principal component scores?|1|213|What is the best way to identify outliers in multivariate data?
222|What are principal component scores?|1|146|PCA scores in multiple regression

tool_use_result.stdout:

222|What are principal component scores?|1|146|PCA scores in multiple regression

content.text:
The query results show that the post "What are principal component scores?" (Id=222) has two related posts via `postLinks`:

1. RelatedPostId=213, Title="What is the best way to identify outliers in multivariate data?", LinkTypeId=1
2. RelatedPostId=146, Title="PCA scores in multiple regression", LinkTypeId=1

The claim states that for the post "What are principal component scores?", a related post is "What is the best way to identify outliers in multivariate data?" with LinkTypeId 1. This exactly matches the first row in the results.
